thread.title: Arsenal v Bayern Munich: Arsene Wenger to drop Theo Walcott for Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal v Bayern Munich: Arsene Wenger to drop Theo Walcott for Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain | Metro News

author: Mark Brus For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal v Bayern Munich: Arsene Wenger to drop Theo Walcott for Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain | Metro News
text:
Arsenal boss Arsene Wenger to drop Theo Walcott for Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain against Bayern Munich gossip Mark Brus for Metro.co.uk Wednesday 15 Feb 2017 3:02 pm Arsene Wenger could tinker his side for the Bayern game (Picture: Getty) 
Arsenal manager Arsene Wenger is reportedly set to drop Theo Walcott in favour of Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain for tonight’s game away to Bayern Munich. ‘How can Gibbs be captain?!’ Man Utd legend Roy Keane TEARS into Arsenal flops 
The Gunners are up against one of their Champions League bogey sides four the fifth time in five seasons, and Wenger seems ready to alter his tactics for the trip to Germany. 
Despite Walcott being largely first choice on the right-hand side this season, Wenger may have lost patience with his lack of recent impact in the first-team. Is Theo Walcott about to be dropped to the bench? (Picture: Getty) 
However, fans may be surprised to see the Frenchman opting to move Oxlade-Chamberlain out of central midfield after his impressive recent form in that new role.
